intro: Trichlora peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian grass or false grass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. Trichlora peruviana is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of arid environments.
